evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On Friday, June 6, 2025, Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officers carried out enforcement actions at multiple locations within Los Angeles County and the City of Los Angeles.

extracted.value: On Friday, June 6, 2025, Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officers carried out enforcement actions at multiple locations within Los Angeles County and the City of Los Angeles.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Prior to the ICE operations, federal officials did not provide the leadership of the Los Angeles Sheriff's Department (LASD) or Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) with any notice as to the planned operations.

extracted.value: Prior to the ICE operations, federal officials did not provide the leadership of the Los Angeles Sheriff's Department (LASD) or Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) with any notice as to the planned operations.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: During the course of these operations, ICE and its agents reportedly took actions that inflamed tensions and provoked protest.

extracted.value: During the course of these operations, ICE and its agents reportedly took actions that inflamed tensions and provoked protest.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In all, the Department of Homeland Security reported that its enforcement activities on Friday, June 6, resulted in the arrest of approximately 44 individuals and 70‑80 people detained in total.

extracted.value: In all, the Department of Homeland Security reported that its enforcement activities on Friday, June 6, resulted in the arrest of approximately 44 individuals and 70‑80 people detained in total.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: That same day, members of the public gathered in protest at the Edward R. Roybal Federal Building and U.S. Courthouse.

extracted.value: That same day, members of the public gathered in protest at the Edward R. Roybal Federal Building and U.S. Courthouse.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: While not unified in their views or tactics, most protesters seemed to have gathered to express their opposition to the manner in which the Trump Administration has executed its immigration agenda.

extracted.value: While not unified in their views or tactics, most protesters seemed to have gathered to express their opposition to the manner in which the Trump Administration has executed its immigration agenda.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: During the protests, Service Employees International Union California leader David Huerta was injured in the midst of interactions with federal agents.

extracted.value: During the protests, Service Employees International Union California leader David Huerta was injured in the midst of interactions with federal agents.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Protests continued on June 7 and June 8, 2025.

extracted.value: Protests continued on June 7 and June 8, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Most of those involved in protesting have been exercising their rights under the First Amendment in a peaceful, non‑violent, and legally compliant manner.

extracted.value: Most of those involved in protesting have been exercising their rights under the First Amendment in a peaceful, non‑violent, and legally compliant manner.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: At no point in the past three days has there been a rebellion or an insurrection.

extracted.value: At no point in the past three days has there been a rebellion or an insurrection.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Both the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) and Los Angeles Sheriff Department (LASD) have substantial training and experience responding to protests and large‑scale riots.

extracted.value: Both the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) and Los Angeles Sheriff Department (LASD) have substantial training and experience responding to protests and large‑scale riots.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In the afternoon of June 6, 2025, some time after protesters had gathered near the Roybal Federal Building and its “B‑18” detention facility, federal agents sent a request to LAPD for assistance.

extracted.value: In the afternoon of June 6, 2025, some time after protesters had gathered near the Roybal Federal Building and its “B‑18” detention facility, federal agents sent a request to LAPD for assistance.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Governor communicated unequivocally and publicly on social media that he disapproved of the federal government’s plans.

extracted.value: The Governor communicated unequivocally and publicly on social media that he disapproved of the federal government’s plans.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On the evening of June 7, President Trump issued a memorandum entitled “Department of Defense Security for the Protection of Department of Homeland Security Functions” (the Trump Memo).

extracted.value: On the evening of June 7, President Trump issued a memorandum entitled “Department of Defense Security for the Protection of Department of Homeland Security Functions” (the Trump Memo).

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Trump Memo does not identify the Los Angeles protests, the State, or any specific geographic region by name, but instead refers to “numerous incidents of violence and disorder” that “have recently occurred and threaten to continue in response” to ICE enforcement of federal immigration laws and to threats to the security of federal immigration detention facilities and other federal property.

extracted.value: The Trump Memo does not identify the Los Angeles protests, the State, or any specific geographic region by name, but instead refers to “numerous incidents of violence and disorder” that “have recently occurred and threaten to continue in response” to ICE enforcement of federal immigration laws and to threats to the security of federal immigration detention facilities and other federal property.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Trump Memo states: “In light of these incidents and credible threats of continued violence, by the authority vested in me as President by the Constitution and the laws of the United States.”

extracted.value: The Trump Memo states: “In light of these incidents and credible threats of continued violence, by the authority vested in me as President by the Constitution and the laws of the United States.”

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Trump Memo further directs the Secretary of Defense to coordinate with the Governors of the States and the National Guard Bureau in identifying and ordering into Federal service the appropriate members and units of the National Guard under this authority.

extracted.value: The Trump Memo further directs the Secretary of Defense to coordinate with the Governors of the States and the National Guard Bureau in identifying and ordering into Federal service the appropriate members and units of the National Guard under this authority.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Early on Saturday, June 7, Border Czar Tom Homan stated “Mayor [Karen] Bass should be thanking us…”

extracted.value: Early on Saturday, June 7, Border Czar Tom Homan stated “Mayor [Karen] Bass should be thanking us…”

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Trump Memo specifies that the members and units called into federal services “shall be at least 2,000 National Guard personnel and the duration of duty shall be for 60 days or at the discretion of the Secretary of Defense.”

extracted.value: The Trump Memo specifies that the members and units called into federal services “shall be at least 2,000 National Guard personnel and the duration of duty shall be for 60 days or at the discretion of the Secretary of Defense.”

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text: The President Lawfully Federalized the National Guard.

extracted.value: The President Lawfully Federalized the National Guard.

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text: The necessary conditions existed for the President’s order

extracted.value: The necessary conditions existed for the President’s order.

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text: Section 12406 does not require a governor’s consent or input.

extracted.value: Section 12406 does not require a governor’s consent or input.

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text: The President lacks authority to federalize the State National Guard

extracted.value: The President lacks authority to federalize the State National Guard.

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text: Section 12406 expressly empowers the President to call the California National Guard into federal service when he considers it necessary to quell a rebellion or when he determines that regular forces are unable to execute federal law.

extracted.value: Section 12406 expressly empowers the President to call the California National Guard into federal service when he considers it necessary to quell a rebellion or when he determines that regular forces are unable to execute federal law.

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text: The President’s unlawful order calling into Federal service members and units of the National Guard under 10 U.S.C. § 12406.

extracted.value: The President’s unlawful order calling into Federal service members and units of the National Guard under 10 U.S.C. § 12406.

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text: On Friday June 6, 2025, protestors threw bottles, concrete chunks, and other objects at FPS officers.

extracted.value: On Friday June 6, 2025, protestors threw bottles, concrete chunks, and other objects at FPS officers.

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text: The protestors used large rolling commercial dumpsters as a battering ram to breach the parking garage gate.

extracted.value: The protestors used large rolling commercial dumpsters as a battering ram to breach the parking garage gate.

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order
evidence.text: The protestors were using chairs, pepper balls, and other items as weapons.

extracted.value: The protestors were using chairs, pepper balls, and other items as weapons.
